result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Trent P McDermott

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on November 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.

[ma] Case called at 1:58pm 
Defendant Trent P McDermott in court.  Attorney Anthony Jurek appears on behalf of Attorney Sarah M Schmeiser in court for Trent P McDermott.  Attorney Brookellen Teuber in court for State of Wisconsin. 

The Court reviews court record. 

Parties waive preliminary hearing time limits.
Atty Jurek requests a preliminary hearing be scheduled. 

recess: 2:00pm 
NEXT: Preliminary Hearing on 11/10/22 at 8:30am

Pre-trial conference on September 21, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on October 10, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Request is summarily granted (Motion for Extension of Time)
Motion for Extension of Time to File Motions to Suppress

Adjustment Number: 22A 185744,
Payable Number: 194617,
Receipt Number: 22R 015367,
Amount: $20.00
Adjourned initial appearance on September 8, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Right to Legal Representation in a Criminal or Criminal Traffic Case

[ml] Case called at 1:47PM
Defendant Trent P McDermott appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, along with Public Defender Jeffrey De La Rosa (PD appears for bond-purposes only; Def does not qualify). Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
Att De La Rosa affirms that the video-connection is sight and sound sufficient. 
The Court recites Right to Counsel. Att De La Rosa advises that he has provided the Defendant with the Petition for a County Appointed Attorney.

The Defendant verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited.
The Court tolls Preliminary Hearing time limits, preserves the Defendant's jurisdictional objections, and sets this matter over for an Adjourned Initial Appearance. 

The Court requires a $500.00 Signature Bond with conditions:
--no possession or ingestion of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--no possession of drug paraphernalia 

recess 1:53PM

NEXT: Adjourned Initial Appearance (also Status of Counsel) on 09/08 at 1:15PM with in person appearances
